definition: Pu Songling (1640-1715), author of 聊齋志異|聊斋志异[Liao2 zhai1 Zhi4 yi4]
refers to various monocotyledonous flowering plants including Acorus calamus and Typha orientalis/common cattail/bullrush

sentences.english: Pu Song Ling, the original author of Liao Zhai, died three centuries ago.
sentences.chinese: 聊齋的原作者蒲松齡死於三個世紀以前。

sentences.english: "Painted Skin" is adapted from the ancient novel "Liaozhai Zhiyi", or "Strange Stories from a Chinese Studio", written by Pu Songling in the Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 《畫皮》取材於清代蒲松齡的古代小說《聊齋志異》。

sentences.english: Pu seventies also want to test Beijing, but still not in the.
sentences.chinese: 蒲松齡七十多歲還欲進京考試，但是還是不中。

sentences.english: I remember when Mr. PU have a lot of beard, and is also busy to the exam.
sentences.chinese: 想當年蒲松齡先生鬍子都一大把了，還忙着去趕考。

definition: Ji Yun (1724-1805), Qing Dynasty writer, author of supernatural novel Notes on a Minutely Observed Thatched Hut 閱微草堂筆記|阅微草堂笔记
Yuan Haowen (1190-1257), famous poet Northern China during the Jin-Yuan transition
Concise History of the Chinese Novel by Lu Xun 鲁迅
pinyin: Zhong1 guo2 Xiao3 shuo1 Shi3 lu:e4

definition: Strange Stories from a Chinese Studio, Qing dynasty book of tales by 蒲松齡|蒲松龄[Pu2 Song1 ling2]
lit. mythical bird Jingwei tries to fill the ocean with stones (idiom); futile ambition/task of Sisyphus/determination in the face of impossible odds
form of writing novels that comprise lots of poetry in the body of the text, popular in the Ming Dynasty
to copy (a text) from person to person/(of a text) to be transmitted by copying
